Tap Mode is not possible with the non root VPN API. Therefore this application cannot provide tap support
Again? Are you kidding? No, tap mode is really not supported and sending more mail asking if it will be supported will not help.

A third time? Actually, one could write a tap emulator based on tun that would add layer2 information on send and strip layer2 information on receive. But this tap emulator would also have to implement ARP and possibly a DHCP client. I am not aware of anybody doing any work in this direction. Contact me if you want to start coding on this.
To copy a single log entry press and hold on the log entry. To copy/send the whole log use the Send Log option. Use the hardware menu button, if the button is not visible in the GUI.

"As OpenVPN is security sensitive a few notes about security are sensible. All data on the sdcard is inherently insecure. Every app can read it (for example this program requires no special sd card rights). The data of this application can only be read by the application itself. By using the import option for cacert/cert/key in the file dialog the data is stored in the VPN profile. The VPN profiles are only accessible by this application. (Do not forget to delete the copies on the sd card afterwards). Even though accessible only by this application the data is still unencrypted. By rooting the telephone or other exploits it may be possible to retrieve the data. Saved passwords are stored in plain text as well. For pkcs12 files it is highly recommended that you import them into the android keystore."

Got an exception trying to show the Android 4.0+ certificate selection dialog. This should never happen as this a standard feature of Android 4.0+. Maybe your Android ROM support for certificate storage is broken

Official HTC images are known to have a strange routing problem causing traffic not to flow through the tunnel (See also Issue 18 in the bug tracker.)

Older official SONY images from Xperia Arc S and Xperia Ray have been reported to be missing the VPNService completely from the image. (See also Issue 29 in the bug tracker.)

On custom build images the tun module might be missing or the rights of /dev/tun might be wrong. Some CM9 images need the "Fix ownership" option under "Device specific hacks" enabled.

Most importantly: If your device has a broken Android image, report it to your vendor. The more people who report an issue to the vendor, the more likely they are to fix it.
Tries to set the owner of /dev/tun to system. Some CM9 images need this to make the VPNService API work. Requires root.

The VPN connection warning telling you that this app can intercept all traffic is imposed by the system to prevent abuse of the VPNService API.\nThe VPN connection notification (The key symbol) is also imposed by the Android system to signal an ongoing VPN connection. On some images this notification plays a sound.\nAndroid introduced these system dialogs for your own safety and made sure that they cannot be circumvented. (On some images this unfortunately includes a notification sound)

If Android is under system memory (RAM) pressure, apps and service which are not needed at the moment are removed from active memory. This terminates an ongoing VPN connection. To ensure that the connection/OpenVPN survives the service runs with higher priority. To run with higher priority the application must display a notification. The key notification icon is imposed by the system as described in the previous FAQ entry. It does not count as app notification for purpose of running with higher priority.
Use the icon to add a new VPN
Use the icon to import an existing (.ovpn or .conf) profile from your sdcard.
Be sure to also check out the FAQ. There is a quick start guide.

The Routing and interface configuration is not done via traditional ifconfig/route commands but by using the VPNService API. This results in a different routing configuration than on other OSes. 
The configuration of the VPN tunnel consists of the IP address and the networks that should be routed over this interface. Especially, no peer partner address or gateway address is needed or required. Special routes to reach the VPN Server (for example added when using redirect-gateway) are not needed either. The application will consequently ignore these settings when importing a configuration. The app ensures with the VPNService API that the connection to the server is not routed through the VPN tunnel.
The VPNService API does not allow specifying networks that should not be routed via the VPN. As a workaround the app tries to detect networks that should not be routed over tunnel (e.g. route x.x.x.x y.y.y.y net_gateway) and calculates a set of routes that excludes this routes to emulate the behaviour of other platforms. The log windows shows the configuration of the VPNService upon establishing a connection.
Behind the scenes: Android 4.4+ does use policy routing. Using route/ifconfig will not show the installed routes. Instead use ip rule, iptables -t mangle -L
Do not fallback to no VPN connection when OpenVPN is reconnecting.

In my personal tests the main reason for high battery consumption of OpenVPN are the keepalive packets. Most OpenVPN servers have a configuration directive like \'keepalive 10 60\' which causes the client and server to exchange keepalive packets every ten seconds.

While these packets are small and do not use much traffic, they keep the mobile radio network busy and increase the energy consumption. (See also The Radio State Machine | Android Developers)

This keepalive setting cannot be changed on the client. Only the system administrator of the OpenVPN can change the setting.

Unfortunately using a keepalive larger than 60 seconds with UDP can cause some NAT gateways to drop the connection due to an inactivity timeout. Using TCP with a long keep alive timeout works, but tunneling TCP over TCP performs extremely poorly on connections with high packet loss. (See Why TCP Over TCP Is A Bad Idea)
The Android Tethering feature (over WiFi, USB or Bluetooth) and the VPNService API (used by this program) do not work together. For more details see the issue #34

Multiple OpenVPN clients for Android exist. The most common ones are OpenVPN for Android (this client), OpenVPN Connect and OpenVPN Settings.

The clients can be grouped into two groups: OpenVPN for Android and OpenVPN Connect use the official VPNService API (Android 4.0+) and require no root and OpenVPN Settings which uses root.

OpenVPN for Android is an open source client and developed by Arne Schwabe. It is targeted at more advanced users and offers many settings and the ability to import profiles from files and to configure/change profiles inside the app. The client is based on the community version of OpenVPN. It is based on the OpenVPN 2.x source code. This client can be seen as the semi officially client of the community.

OpenVPN Connect is non open source client that is developed by OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. The client is indented to be general use client and more targeted at the average user and allows the import of OpenVPN profiles. This client is based on the OpenVPN C++ reimplementation of the OpenVPN protocol (This was required to allow OpenVPN Technologies, Inc to publish an iOS OpenVPN app). This client is the official client of the OpenVPN technologies

OpenVPN Settings is the oldest of the clients and also a UI for the open source OpenVPN. In contrast to OpenVPN for Android it requires root and does not use the VPNService API. It does not depend on Android 4.0+
Differences between the OpenVPN Android clients
Android supports only CIDR routes to the VPN. Since non-CIDR routes are almost never used, OpenVPN for Android will use a /32 for routes that are not CIDR and issue a warning.
Tethering works while the VPN is active. The tethered connection will NOT use the VPN.
Early KitKat version set the wrong MSS value on TCP connections (#61948). Try to enable the mssfix option to workaround this bug.

Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for the mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set. OpenVPN for Android will warn you about this in the log.
When a VPN sets a DNS server Android will not use a proxy. There is no API to set a proxy for a VPN connection.
VPN apps may stop working when uninstalled and reinstalled again. For details see #80074
The configured client IP and the IPs in its network mask are not routed to the VPN. OpenVPN works around this bug by explicitly adding a route that corrosponds to the client IP and its netmask

Opening a tun device while another tun device is active, which is used for persist-tun support, crashes the VPNServices on the device. A reboot is required to make VPN work again. OpenVPN for Android tries to avoid reopening the tun device and if really needed first closes the current TUN before opening the new TUN device to avoid to crash. This may lead to a short window where packets are sent over the non-VPN connection. Even with this workaround the VPNServices sometimes crashes and requires a reboot of the device.
VPN does not work at all for secondary users.

"Multiple users report that the mobile connection/mobile data connection is frequently dropped while using the VPN app. The behaviour seems to affect only some mobile provider/device combination and so far no cause/workaround for the bug could be identified. "

Newer OpenVPN for Android versions (0.6.29/March 2015) use a more secure default for the allowed cipher suites (tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"). Unfortunately, omitting the less secure cipher suites and export cipher suites, especially the omission of cipher suites that do not support Perfect Forward Secrecy (Diffie-Hellman) causes some problems. This usually caused by an well-intentioned but poorly executed attempt to strengthen TLS security by setting tls-cipher on the server or some embedded OSes with stripped down SSL (e.g. MikroTik).\nTo solve this problem the problem, set the tls-cipher settings on the server to reasonable default like tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\". To work around the problem on the client add the custom option tls-cipher DEFAULT on the Android client.

Even though Samsung phones are among the most selling Android phones, Samsung's firmware are also among the most buggy Android firmwares. The bugs are not limited to the VPN operation on these devices but many of them can be workarounded. In the following some of these bugs are described.

DNS does not work unless the DNS server in the VPN range.

On many Samsung 5.x devices the allowed/disallowed apps feature does not work.
On Samsung 6.x VPN is reported not to work unless the VPN app is exempted from Powersave features.
VPN used in places where a default VPN needed. These are currently on boot, for Always-On and the Quick Settings Tile.
Enter the maximum time between connection attempts. OpenVPN will slowly raise its waiting time after an unsuccessful connection attempt up to this value. Defaults to 300s.

If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have \"Always on VPN\" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS
Profiles sorted by last recently used
Config uses option tls-remote that was deprecated in 2.3 and finally removed in 2.4

Starting with OpenSSL version 1.1, OpenSSL rejects weak signatures in certificates like MD5.

MD5 signatures are completely insecure and should not be used anymore. MD5 collisions can be created in few hours at a minimal cost.. You should update the VPN certificates as soon as possible.

Unfortunately, older easy-rsa distributions included the config option "default_md md5". If you are using an old easy-rsa version, update to the latest version) or change md5 to sha256 and regenerate your certificates.

If you really want to use old and broken certificates use the custom configuration option tls-cipher "DEFAULT:@SECLEVEL=0" under advanced configuration or as additional line in your imported configuration
Ongoing statistics of the established OpenVPN connection
Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (Connecting, authenticating,…)
Weak (MD5) hashes in certificate signature (SSL_CTX_use_certificate md too weak)

OpenVPN for Android supports two remote APIs, a sophisticated API using AIDL (remoteEXample in the git repository) and a simple one using Intents.

Examples using adb shell and the intents. Replace profilname with your profile name

adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.DisconnectVPN

adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN -e de.blinkt.openvpn.api.profileName Blinkt de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.ConnectVPN
Cannot use extra http-proxy-option statement and Orbot integration at the same time

Open URL to continue VPN authentication
Answer challenge to continue VPN authentication

It is often desired to block connections without VPN. Other apps often use markting terms like \"Killswitch\" or \"Seamless tunnel\" for this feature. OpenVPN and this app offer persist-tun, a feature to implement this functionality.

The problem with all these methods offered by apps is that they can only provide best effort and are no complete solutions. On boot, app crashing and other corner cases the app cannot ensure that this block of non VPN connection works. Thus giving the user a false sense of security.

The only reliable way to ensure non VPN connections are blocked is to use Android 8.0 or later and use the \"block connections without VPN\" setting that can be found under Settings > Network & Internet > Advanced/VPN > OpenVPN for Android > Enable Always ON VPN, Enable Block Connections without VPN
This option instructs Android to not allow protocols (IPv4/IPv6) if the VPN does not set any IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.
Block IPv6 (or IPv4) if not used by the VPN

Opening a tun device while another tun device is active, which is used for persist-tun support, crashes the VPNServices on the device. A reboot is required to make VPN work again. OpenVPN for Android tries to avoid reopening the tun device and if really needed first closes the current TUN before opening the new TUN device to avoid to crash. This may lead to a short window where packets are sent over the non-VPN connection. Even with this workaround the VPNServices sometimes crashes and requires a reboot of the device.
Only destination can be reached over the VPN that are reachable without VPN. IPv6 VPNs does not work at all.

配置路由和接口不是用传统的 ifconfig/route 命令完成的，而是用VPN服务API。这导致与其他操作系统不同的路由配置。 
VPN 隧道配置由 IP 地址和应通过此接口路由的网络组成。特别地，对端地址或网关地址不是必需的或不需要的。也不需要访问 VPN 服务器的特殊路由（例如，在使用重定向网关时添加）。因此，应用程序在导入配置时将忽略这些设置。使用 VPNService API，应用程序可确保与服务器的连接不通过 VPN 隧道路由。
VPNService API 不允许您指定不应通过 VPN 路由的网络。作为解决方法，应用程序会尝试发现不应通过隧道路由的网络（例如，路由 xxxx yyyy net_gateway）并计算一组排除这些路由的路由以模拟其他平台的行为。建立连接时，日志窗口会显示 VPNService 配置。
在幕后：Android 4.4+ 使用基于策略的路由。使用 route/ifconfig 不会显示已安装的路由。改为使用 ip 规则，iptables -t mangle -L
当 OpenVPN 重新连接时，不要回退到没有 VPN 连接。

在我的个人测试中，保活数据包是OpenVPN耗电高的主要原因。大多数 OpenVPN 服务器都有一个配置指令，例如“keepalive 10 60”，它会导致客户端和服务器每十秒交换一次 keepalive 数据包。 尽管这些数据包很小并且不会使用太多流量，但它们会给移动无线电网络带来负载并增加功耗。 （另请参阅< a href="https://developer.android.com/training/efficient-downloads/efficient-network-access.html#RadioStateMachine" >无线电状态机 | Android 开发人员< ) 无法在客户端上更改此保活设置。只有 OpenVPN 系统管理员可以更改设置。不幸的是，通过 UDP 使用 keepalive 超过 60 秒可能会导致某些NAT 网关因空闲超时而断开连接。使用长健康检查超时的 TCP 是可行的，但通过 TCP 隧道传输 TCP 在丢包率高的连接上表现极差。 （参见< a href="http://sites.inka.de/bigred/devel/tcp-tcp.html" >为什么在 TCP 上使用 TCP 是个坏主意< /a > ）

Android有几个OpenVPN客户端。最常见的是 OpenVPN for Android（此客户端）、OpenVPN Connect 和 OpenVPN 设置。客户端可分为两组：OpenVPN for Android 和 OpenVPN Connect 使用官方 VPNService API（Android 4.0+）并且不需要 root 和使用 root 的 OpenVPN 设置。OpenVPN for Android 是由 Arne Schwabe 开发的开源客户端。它面向更高级的用户，提供大量设置和从文件导入配置文件以及在应用程序内配置/更改配置文件的能力。客户端基于 OpenVPN 的公共版本。它基于 OpenVPN 2.x 源代码。这个客户端可以看作是一个半官方的社区客户端。 OpenVPN Connect 是由 OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. 开发的开源客户端。该客户端适用于一般用途，更适合普通用户，并允许您导入 OpenVPN 配置文件。此客户端基于 OpenVPN C++ OpenVPN 协议的重新实现（这是允许 OpenVPN Technologies, Inc 发布 OpenVPN iOS 应用程序所必需的）。本客户端为官方OpenVPN技术客户端. OpenVPN Settings 是最早的客户端，也是 OpenVPN 的开源用户界面。与 Android 的 OpenVPN 不同，它需要 root 并且不使用 VPNService API。这与Android 4.0+无关
Android 仅支持到 VPN 的 CIDR 路由。由于几乎从不使用非 CIDR 路由，Android 版 OpenVPN 将对非 CIDR 路由使用 /32 并发出警告。
只要 VPN 处于活动状态，网络共享就会工作。系留连接不会使用 VPN。
早期版本的 KitKat 为 TCP 连接设置了错误的 MSS 值 (#61948)。尝试启用 mssfix 设置来解决此错误。
如果未设置 DNS 服务器，Android 将继续使用为移动/Wi-Fi 连接指定的代理设置。 OpenVPN for Android 将在日志中警告您。当 VPN 设置 DNS 服务器时，Android 将不使用代理。没有为 VPN 连接设置代理的 API。
VPN 应用程序在卸载和重新安装时可能会停止工作。有关详细信息，请参见#80074

已配置的客户端 IP 地址及其网络掩码中的 IP 地址未路由到 VPN。 OpenVPN 通过显式添加与客户端的 IP 地址和网络掩码相匹配的路由来解决此错误，使设备上的 VPNServices 崩溃。 VPN 需要重新启动才能再次工作。 OpenVPN for Android 尝试避免重新打开 TUN 设备，如果确实有必要，在打开新 TUN 设备之前先关闭当前 TUN 以避免崩溃。当通过非 VPN 连接发送数据包时，这可能会导致窗口变短。即使采用此解决方法，VPNServices 有时也会崩溃并需要重启设备。
VPN 对二级用户根本不起作用。

Android 版 OpenVPN 的新版本（0.6.29/2015 年 3 月）对允许的密码套件使用更安全的默认值（tls 密码“DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\”）。不幸的是，排除不太安全的密码套件和导出密码套件，尤其是缺少不支持完全前向保密 (Diffie-Hellman) 的密码套件，会导致一些问题。这通常是由于通过在服务器上设置 tls 密码或某些带有 cut SSL 的嵌入式操作系统（如 MikroTik）来加强 TLS 安全性的意图良好但执行不力的尝试。\n要解决此问题，请将 tls 密码设置设置为服务器设置为合理的默认值，例如 tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"。要解决客户端上的问题，请在 Android 客户端上添加 tls-cipher DEFAULT 用户选项。

< p>从OpenSSL 1.1版本开始，OpenSSL拒绝MD5等证书中的弱签名。 MD5 签名是完全不安全的，不应再使用。可以在<中创建MD5 冲突ahref="https://natmchugh.blogspot.de/2015/02/create-your-own-md5-collisions.html">几个小时的最低价。您应该尽快更新您的 VPN 证书。 不幸的是，easy-rsa 的旧发行版包含“default_md md5”配置选项。如果您使用的是旧版本的 easy-rsa，请更新到< a href="https://github.com/OpenVPN/easy-rsa/releases">最新版本) 或将 md5 更改为 sha256 并重新生成您的证书。 如果您真的想使用旧的和损坏的证书，请在高级配置中使用“DEFAULT:@SECLEVEL=0”自定义配置选项 tls-cipher 或作为导入的额外行< /p>

OpenVPN for Android 支持两个远程 API，复杂的 API 使用 AIDL ( remoteEXample in git 存储库）和简单的使用 Intents。 adb shell 用法和意图示例。将配置文件名称替换为您的配置文件名称< p> adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.DisconnectVPN < p> adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN -e de.blinkt.openvpn.api.profileName Blinkt de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.ConnectVPN

通常需要在没有 VPN 的情况下阻止连接。其他应用程序通常为此功能使用标签术语，例如“Killswitch”或“Seamless Tunnel”。 OpenVPN 和这个应用程序提供了一个 persist-tun 功能来实现这个功能。应用程序提供的所有这些方法的问题在于它们只能尽力而为，而不是完整的解决方案。在启动、应用程序崩溃和其他边缘情况下，应用程序无法保证此非 VPN 连接块正常工作。这给用户一种错误的安全感 确保阻止非 VPN 连接的可靠方法是使用 Android 8.0 或更高版本，并使用“设置”>“网络和网络”中的“阻止非 VPN 连接”选项。Internet > Advanced / VPN > Android 版OpenVPN >启用Always ON VPN ，启用无 VPN IPv4或 IPv6 地址的连接阻止。

"Debido a que OpenVPN es sensible a la seguridad, algunos comentarios sobre la seguridad tienen sentido. Todos los datos en una tarjeta SD son intrínsecamente inseguros. Cada aplicación puede leerlos (por ejemplo, este programa no requiere derechos especiales para la tarjeta SD). Los datos de esta aplicación solo pueden ser leídos por la propia aplicación. Cuando se utiliza la opción de importación para cacert/cert/key en el cuadro de diálogo de archivo, los datos se almacenan en el perfil de VPN. Los perfiles VPN solo están disponibles para esta aplicación. (No olvide borrar las copias en la tarjeta SD después de eso). e los datos aún no están encriptados. Es posible obtener datos rooteando el teléfono u otros exploits. Las contraseñas guardadas también se almacenan en texto sin formato. Para los archivos pkcs12, se recomienda importarlos al almacén de claves de Android."

Cuando Android se queda sin memoria del sistema (RAM), las aplicaciones y los servicios que no se necesitan actualmente se eliminan de la memoria activa. Esto finaliza la conexión VPN actual. Para garantizar que la conexión/OpenVPN sobreviva, el servicio se ejecuta con una prioridad más alta. Para ejecutarse con una prioridad más alta, la aplicación debe mostrar una notificación. El icono de notificación clave está superpuesto por el sistema como se describe en la sección de preguntas frecuentes anterior. Esto no se considera una notificación a la aplicación para que se ejecute con una prioridad más alta.

Utilice < img src=\"ic_menu_add\"/ > para agregar una nueva VPN
Utilice < img src=\"ic_menu_archive\"/ > para importar un perfil existente (.ovpn o .conf) desde la tarjeta SD.
Asegúrese de consultar también las preguntas frecuentes. Hay una guía rápida.

La configuración del enrutamiento y la interfaz no se realiza con los comandos tradicionales ifconfig/route, sino con API de servicio VPN. Esto da como resultado una configuración de enrutamiento diferente a la de otros sistemas operativos. 
La configuración del túnel VPN consta de la dirección IP y las redes que deben enrutarse a través de esta interfaz. En particular, no se requiere ni se requiere una dirección de pares o una dirección de puerta de enlace. Tampoco se necesitan rutas especiales para acceder al servidor VPN (por ejemplo, agregadas cuando se usa una puerta de enlace de redirección). Por lo tanto, la aplicación ignorará estos ajustes al importar la configuración. Con la API de VPNService, la aplicación garantiza que la conexión al servidor no se enrute a través del túnel VPN.
La API de VPNService no le permite especificar redes que no deben enrutarse a través de la VPN. Como solución alternativa, la aplicación intenta descubrir redes que no deben enrutarse a través del túnel (por ejemplo, la ruta xxxx yyyy net_gateway) y calcula un conjunto de rutas que excluye estas rutas para emular el comportamiento de otras plataformas. Las ventanas de registro muestran la configuración de VPNService cuando se establece una conexión.
Detrás de escena: Android 4.4+ usa enrutamiento basado en políticas. El uso de route/ifconfig no mostrará las rutas instaladas. Utilice la regla ip en su lugar, iptables -t mangle -L
No recurra a ninguna conexión VPN cuando OpenVPN se vuelva a conectar.

En mis pruebas personales, los paquetes de mantenimiento son la causa principal del alto consumo de batería de OpenVPN. La mayoría de los servidores OpenVPN tienen una directiva de configuración como "keepalive 10 60" que hace que el cliente y el servidor intercambien paquetes keepalive cada diez segundos. < pag > Aunque estos paquetes son pequeños y no usan mucho tráfico, cargan la red de radio móvil y aumentan el consumo de energía. (Consulte también < a href="https://developer.android.com/training/ficient-downloads/ficient-network-access.html#RadioStateMachine" > The Radio State Machine | Desarrolladores de Android < /a &gt ; ) < pag > Esta configuración de keepalive no se puede cambiar en el cliente. Solo el administrador del sistema OpenVPN puede cambiar la configuración. < pag > Desafortunadamente, el uso de keepalive durante más de 60 segundos con UDP puede hacer que algunas puertas de enlace NAT interrumpan la conexión debido a un tiempo de inactividad. El uso de TCP con un tiempo de espera de verificación de estado prolongado funciona, pero la tunelización de TCP sobre TCP funciona extremadamente mal en conexiones con una gran pérdida de paquetes. (Ver < a href="http://sites.inka.de/bigred/devel/tcp-tcp.html" > Por qué usar TCP sobre TCP es una mala idea < /a > )

Hay varios clientes OpenVPN para Android. Los más comunes son OpenVPN para Android (este cliente), OpenVPN Connect y OpenVPN Settings. < pag > Los clientes se pueden dividir en dos grupos: OpenVPN para Android y OpenVPN Connect usan la API oficial de VPNService (Android 4.0+) y no requieren la configuración de root y OpenVPN que usa root. < pag > OpenVPN para Android es un cliente de código abierto desarrollado por Arne Schwabe. Está dirigido a usuarios más avanzados y ofrece una gran cantidad de configuraciones y la posibilidad de importar perfiles desde archivos, así como configurar/cambiar perfiles dentro de la aplicación. El cliente se basa en la versión pública de OpenVPN. Se basa en el código fuente de OpenVPN 2.x. Este cliente puede ser considerado como un cliente comunitario semioficial. < pag > OpenVPN Connect es un cliente de código abierto desarrollado por OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. El cliente está pensado para un uso general y está más orientado al usuario medio y permite importar perfiles OpenVPN. Este cliente se basa en la reimplementación de OpenVPN C++ del protocolo OpenVPN (esto fue necesario para permitir que OpenVPN Technologies, Inc publicara la aplicación iOS de OpenVPN). Este cliente es un cliente oficial de tecnología OpenVPN < pag > OpenVPN Settings es el más antiguo de los clientes y también la interfaz de usuario de código abierto para OpenVPN. A diferencia de OpenVPN para Android, requiere root y no utiliza la API VPNService. Esto es independiente de Android 4.0+
Diferencias entre los clientes OpenVPN de Android
Android solo admite rutas CIDR a VPN. Debido a que las rutas que no son CIDR casi nunca se usan, OpenVPN para Android usará /32 para las rutas que no sean CIDR y emitirá una advertencia.
La conexión funciona siempre que la VPN esté activa. La conexión anclada NO utilizará la VPN.
Una versión anterior de KitKat establecía un valor de MSS incorrecto para las conexiones TCP (#61948). Intente habilitar la configuración de mssfix para evitar este error.

Android continuará usando la configuración de proxy especificada para la conexión móvil/Wi-Fi si no se configuran servidores DNS. OpenVPN para Android le advertirá sobre esto en un registro.
Cuando VPN configura un servidor DNS, Android no usará un proxy. No existe una API para configurar un proxy para una conexión VPN.
Las aplicaciones VPN pueden dejar de funcionar cuando se desinstalan y se vuelven a instalar. Consulte #80074 para obtener detalles

La dirección IP del cliente configurada y las direcciones IP en su máscara de red no se enrutan a la VPN. OpenVPN soluciona este error agregando explícitamente una ruta que coincide con la dirección IP y la máscara de red del cliente

Abriendo un dispositivo tun cuando otro dispositivo tun está activo, que se usa para soportar la persistencia tun. , bloquea VPNServices en el dispositivo. Es necesario reiniciar para que la VPN vuelva a funcionar. OpenVPN para Android intenta evitar volver a abrir el dispositivo TUN y, si es realmente necesario, cierra primero el TUN actual antes de abrir un nuevo dispositivo TUN para evitar fallas. Esto puede resultar en una ventana corta cuando los paquetes se envían a través de una conexión que no es VPN. Incluso con esta solución, VPNServices a veces falla y requiere reiniciar el dispositivo.
VPN no funciona en absoluto para usuarios secundarios.

Las nuevas versiones de OpenVPN para Android (0.6.29/marzo de 2015) utilizan un valor predeterminado más seguro para los conjuntos de cifrado permitidos (cifrado tls "DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"). Desafortunadamente, la exclusión de conjuntos de cifrado menos seguros y conjuntos de cifrado de exportación, especialmente la ausencia de conjuntos de cifrado que no admiten el secreto directo perfecto (Diffie-Hellman), causa algunos problemas. Esto generalmente es causado por un intento bien intencionado pero mal ejecutado de fortalecer la seguridad TLS configurando un cifrado tls en el servidor, o algún sistema operativo integrado con SSL cortado (como MikroTik).\nPara resolver este problema, establezca la configuración de cifrado tls en el servidor a valores predeterminados razonables, como tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\". Para solucionar el problema en el cliente, agregue la opción de usuario tls-cipher DEFAULT en el cliente de Android.

Aunque los teléfonos Samsung se encuentran entre los teléfonos Android más vendidos, el firmware de Samsung también es uno de los firmware de Android con más errores. Los errores no se limitan a la operación de VPN en estos dispositivos, pero muchos de ellos se pueden omitir. Algunos de estos errores se describen a continuación.

El DNS no funciona si el servidor DNS no está dentro del alcance de la VPN.

< p>A partir de OpenSSL versión 1.1, OpenSSL rechaza firmas débiles en certificados comoMD5. < /p> < pag> < b> Las firmas MD5 son completamente inseguras y no deberían usarse más. < /b> Las colisiones MD5se pueden crear en < ahref="https://natmchugh.blogspot.de/2015/02/create-your-own-md5-collisions.html">unas pocas horas al precio más bajo. < /a>.Debe actualizar sus certificados de VPN lo antes posible. < /p> < p>Desafortunadamente, lasdistribuciones antiguas de easy-rsa incluían la opción de configuración "default_md md5". A menudo es deseable bloquear las conexiones sin una VPN. Otras aplicaciones suelen utilizar términos de etiquetado como "Killswitch" o "Seamless Tunnel" para esta función. OpenVPN y esta aplicación ofrecen una función de sintonización persistente para implementar esta función. < p>El problema de todos estos métodos que ofrecen las aplicaciones es que solo pueden hacerlo lo mejor posible y no son una solución completa. En el arranque, el bloqueo de la aplicación y otros casos extremos, la aplicación no puede garantizar que este bloque de conexión que no es VPN esté funcionando. Esto le da al usuario una falsa sensación de seguridad. < pag> < b>solo < /b> Una forma segura de asegurarse de que las conexiones que no son de VPN estén bloqueadas es usar Android 8.0 o posterior y usar la opción "bloquear conexiones que no son de VPN" que se encuentra en Configuración > Red y red. Internet > Avanzado/ VPN >OpenVPN para Android > Habilitar VPN siempre activada, Habilitar bloqueo de conexión sin direcciones VPN IPv4 o IPv6.

"As OpenVPN is security sensitive a few notes about security are sensible. All data on the sdcard is inherently insecure. Every app can read it (for example this program requires no special sd card rights). The data of this application can only be read by the application itself. By using the import option for cacert/cert/key in the file dialog the data is stored in the VPN profile. The VPN profiles are only accessible by this application. (Do not forget to delete the copies on the sd card afterwards). Even though accessible only by this application the data is still unencrypted. By rooting the telephone or other exploits it may be possible to retrieve the data. Saved passwords are stored in plain text as well. For pkcs12 files it is highly recommended that you import them into the android keystore."

Most importantly: If your device has a broken Android image, report it to your vendor. The more people who report an issue to the vendor, the more likely they are to fix it.

If Android is under system memory (RAM) pressure, apps and service which are not needed at the moment are removed from active memory. This terminates an ongoing VPN connection. To ensure that the connection/OpenVPN survives the service runs with higher priority. To run with higher priority the application must display a notification. The key notification icon is imposed by the system as described in the previous FAQ entry. It does not count as app notification for purpose of running with higher priority.
Use the icon to add a new VPN
Use the icon to import an existing (.ovpn or .conf) profile from your sdcard.
Be sure to also check out the FAQ. There is a quick start guide.

The Routing and interface configuration is not done via traditional ifconfig/route commands but by using the VPNService API. This results in a different routing configuration than on other OSes. 
The configuration of the VPN tunnel consists of the IP address and the networks that should be routed over this interface. Especially, no peer partner address or gateway address is needed or required. Special routes to reach the VPN Server (for example added when using redirect-gateway) are not needed either. The application will consequently ignore these settings when importing a configuration. The app ensures with the VPNService API that the connection to the server is not routed through the VPN tunnel.
The VPNService API does not allow specifying networks that should not be routed via the VPN. As a workaround the app tries to detect networks that should not be routed over tunnel (e.g. route x.x.x.x y.y.y.y net_gateway) and calculates a set of routes that excludes this routes to emulate the behaviour of other platforms. The log windows shows the configuration of the VPNService upon establishing a connection.
Behind the scenes: Android 4.4+ does use policy routing. Using route/ifconfig will not show the installed routes. Instead use ip rule, iptables -t mangle -L
Do not fallback to no VPN connection when OpenVPN is reconnecting.

In my personal tests the main reason for high battery consumption of OpenVPN are the keepalive packets. Most OpenVPN servers have a configuration directive like \'keepalive 10 60\' which causes the client and server to exchange keepalive packets every ten seconds.

While these packets are small and do not use much traffic, they keep the mobile radio network busy and increase the energy consumption. (See also The Radio State Machine | Android Developers)

This keepalive setting cannot be changed on the client. Only the system administrator of the OpenVPN can change the setting.

Unfortunately using a keepalive larger than 60 seconds with UDP can cause some NAT gateways to drop the connection due to an inactivity timeout. Using TCP with a long keep alive timeout works, but tunneling TCP over TCP performs extremely poorly on connections with high packet loss. (See Why TCP Over TCP Is A Bad Idea)

Multiple OpenVPN clients for Android exist. The most common ones are OpenVPN for Android (this client), OpenVPN Connect and OpenVPN Settings.

The clients can be grouped into two groups: OpenVPN for Android and OpenVPN Connect use the official VPNService API (Android 4.0+) and require no root and OpenVPN Settings which uses root.

OpenVPN for Android is an open source client and developed by Arne Schwabe. It is targeted at more advanced users and offers many settings and the ability to import profiles from files and to configure/change profiles inside the app. The client is based on the community version of OpenVPN. It is based on the OpenVPN 2.x source code. This client can be seen as the semi officially client of the community.

OpenVPN Connect is non open source client that is developed by OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. The client is indented to be general use client and more targeted at the average user and allows the import of OpenVPN profiles. This client is based on the OpenVPN C++ reimplementation of the OpenVPN protocol (This was required to allow OpenVPN Technologies, Inc to publish an iOS OpenVPN app). This client is the official client of the OpenVPN technologies

OpenVPN Settings is the oldest of the clients and also a UI for the open source OpenVPN. In contrast to OpenVPN for Android it requires root and does not use the VPNService API. It does not depend on Android 4.0+
Differences between the OpenVPN Android clients
Android supports only CIDR routes to the VPN. Since non-CIDR routes are almost never used, OpenVPN for Android will use a /32 for routes that are not CIDR and issue a warning.
Tethering works while the VPN is active. The tethered connection will NOT use the VPN.
Early KitKat version set the wrong MSS value on TCP connections (#61948). Try to enable the mssfix option to workaround this bug.

Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for the mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set. OpenVPN for Android will warn you about this in the log.
When a VPN sets a DNS server Android will not use a proxy. There is no API to set a proxy for a VPN connection.
VPN apps may stop working when uninstalled and reinstalled again. For details see #80074
The configured client IP and the IPs in its network mask are not routed to the VPN. OpenVPN works around this bug by explicitly adding a route that corrosponds to the client IP and its netmask

Opening a tun device while another tun device is active, which is used for persist-tun support, crashes the VPNServices on the device. A reboot is required to make VPN work again. OpenVPN for Android tries to avoid reopening the tun device and if really needed first closes the current TUN before opening the new TUN device to avoid to crash. This may lead to a short window where packets are sent over the non-VPN connection. Even with this workaround the VPNServices sometimes crashes and requires a reboot of the device.
VPN does not work at all for secondary users.

Newer OpenVPN for Android versions (0.6.29/March 2015) use a more secure default for the allowed cipher suites (tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"). Unfortunately, omitting the less secure cipher suites and export cipher suites, especially the omission of cipher suites that do not support Perfect Forward Secrecy (Diffie-Hellman) causes some problems. This usually caused by an well-intentioned but poorly executed attempt to strengthen TLS security by setting tls-cipher on the server or some embedded OSes with stripped down SSL (e.g. MikroTik).\nTo solve this problem the problem, set the tls-cipher settings on the server to reasonable default like tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\". To work around the problem on the client add the custom option tls-cipher DEFAULT on the Android client.

Even though Samsung phones are among the most selling Android phones, Samsung's firmware are also among the most buggy Android firmwares. The bugs are not limited to the VPN operation on these devices but many of them can be workarounded. In the following some of these bugs are described.

On many Samsung 5.x devices the allowed/disallowed apps feature does not work.
On Samsung 6.x VPN is reported not to work unless the VPN app is exempted from Powersave features.

Starting with OpenSSL version 1.1, OpenSSL rejects weak signatures in certificates like MD5.

MD5 signatures are completely insecure and should not be used anymore. MD5 collisions can be created in few hours at a minimal cost.. You should update the VPN certificates as soon as possible.

Unfortunately, older easy-rsa distributions included the config option "default_md md5". If you are using an old easy-rsa version, update to the latest version) or change md5 to sha256 and regenerate your certificates.

If you really want to use old and broken certificates use the custom configuration option tls-cipher "DEFAULT:@SECLEVEL=0" under advanced configuration or as additional line in your imported configuration
Ongoing statistics of the established OpenVPN connection
Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (Connecting, authenticating,…)

OpenVPN for Android supports two remote APIs, a sophisticated API using AIDL (remoteEXample in the git repository) and a simple one using Intents.

Examples using adb shell and the intents. Replace profilname with your profile name

adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.DisconnectVPN

It is often desired to block connections without VPN. Other apps often use markting terms like \"Killswitch\" or \"Seamless tunnel\" for this feature. OpenVPN and this app offer persist-tun, a feature to implement this functionality.

The problem with all these methods offered by apps is that they can only provide best effort and are no complete solutions. On boot, app crashing and other corner cases the app cannot ensure that this block of non VPN connection works. Thus giving the user a false sense of security.

The only reliable way to ensure non VPN connections are blocked is to use Android 8.0 or later and use the \"block connections without VPN\" setting that can be found under Settings > Network & Internet > Advanced/VPN > OpenVPN for Android > Enable Always ON VPN, Enable Block Connections without VPN
This option instructs Android to not allow protocols (IPv4/IPv6) if the VPN does not set any IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.
Block IPv6 (or IPv4) if not used by the VPN
Default VPN not set. Please set the Default VPN before enabling this option.

Третий раз? На самом деле, можно написать эмулятор касания на основе tun, который будет добавлять информацию уровня 2 при отправке и удалять информацию уровня 2 при получении. «Поскольку OpenVPN чувствителен к безопасности, несколько замечаний о безопасности имеют смысл. Все данные на SD-карте по своей природе небезопасны. Каждое приложение может их прочитать (например, эта программа не требует специальных прав на SD-карту). Данные этого приложения можно только читать самим приложением. При использовании опции импорта для cacert/cert/key в файловом диалоге данные сохраняются в профиле VPN. Профили VPN доступны только этому приложению. (Не забудьте удалить копии на SD карту после этого). e данные все еще не зашифрованы. Получение данных возможно путем рутирования телефона или других эксплойтов. Сохраненные пароли также хранятся в виде обычного текста. Для файлов pkcs12 настоятельно рекомендуется импортировать их в хранилище ключей Android."

Если Android испытывает нехватку системной памяти (ОЗУ), приложения и службы, которые не нужны в данный момент, удаляются из активной памяти. Это завершает текущее VPN-соединение. Чтобы гарантировать, что соединение/OpenVPN выживет, служба работает с более высоким приоритетом. Для запуска с более высоким приоритетом приложение должно отображать уведомление. Значок ключевого уведомления накладывается системой, как описано в предыдущем разделе часто задаваемых вопросов. Это не считается уведомлением приложения для запуска с более высоким приоритетом.
Используйте < img src=\"ic_menu_add\"/ > чтобы добавить новую VPN
Используйте < img src=\"ic_menu_archive\"/ > чтобы импортировать существующий профиль (.ovpn или .conf) с SD-карты.
Обязательно также ознакомьтесь с FAQ. Имеется краткое руководство.

Настройка маршрутизации и интерфейса выполняется не с помощью традиционных команд ifconfig/route, а с помощью VPNService API. Это приводит к другой конфигурации маршрутизации, чем в других ОС. 
Конфигурация VPN-туннеля состоит из IP-адреса и сетей, которые должны маршрутизироваться через этот интерфейс. В частности, адрес однорангового партнера или адрес шлюза не требуются и не требуются. Специальные маршруты для доступа к VPN-серверу (например, добавленные при использовании шлюза перенаправления) также не нужны. Следовательно, приложение будет игнорировать эти параметры при импорте конфигурации. С помощью VPNService API приложение гарантирует, что соединение с сервером не будет маршрутизироваться через VPN-туннель.
VPNService API не позволяет указывать сети, которые не должны маршрутизироваться через VPN. В качестве обходного пути приложение пытается обнаружить сети, которые не должны маршрутизироваться через туннель (например, маршрут xxxx yyyy net_gateway), и вычисляет набор маршрутов, исключающий эти маршруты, чтобы эмулировать поведение других платформ. Окна журнала показывают конфигурацию VPNService при установлении соединения.
За кулисами: Android 4.4+ использует маршрутизацию на основе политик. Использование route/ifconfig не покажет установленные маршруты. Вместо этого используйте правило ip, iptables -t mangle -L
Не возвращаться к отсутствию VPN-соединения при повторном подключении OpenVPN.

В моих личных тестах основной причиной высокого расхода батареи OpenVPN являются пакеты проверки активности. Большинство серверов OpenVPN имеют директиву конфигурации, такую как «keepalive 10 60», которая заставляет клиент и сервер обмениваться пакетами проверки активности каждые десять секунд. < р > Несмотря на то, что эти пакеты малы и не используют много трафика, они загружают мобильную радиосеть и увеличивают потребление энергии. (См. также < a href="https://developer.android.com/training/efficient-downloads/efficient-network-access.html#RadioStateMachine" > The Radio State Machine | Android Developers < /a > ) < р > Этот параметр поддержки активности нельзя изменить на клиенте. Только системный администратор OpenVPN может изменить настройку. < р > К сожалению, использование поддержки активности более 60 секунд с UDP может привести к тому, что некоторые шлюзы NAT прервут соединение из-за тайм-аута бездействия. Использование TCP с длительным тайм-аутом проверки работоспособности работает, но туннелирование TCP через TCP крайне плохо работает при соединениях с высокой потерей пакетов. (См. < a href="http://sites.inka.de/bigred/devel/tcp-tcp.html" > Почему использование TCP через TCP — плохая идея < /a > )

Функция Android Tethering (через WiFi, USB или Bluetooth) и VPNService API (используемый этой программой) не работают вместе. Дополнительные сведения см. в разделе < a href=\"https://github.com/schwabe/ics-openvpn/issues/34\">выпуск № 34 < /a>

"Начиная с Android 4.3 подтверждение VPN защищено от \"наложения AP пс\". Это приводит к тому, что диалоговое окно не реагирует на сенсорный ввод. Если у вас есть приложение, которое использует наложения, это может привести к такому поведению. Если вы обнаружите оскорбительное приложение, свяжитесь с автором приложения. Эта проблема затрагивает все приложения VPN на Android 4.3 и более поздних версиях. См. также < a href=\"https://github.com/schwabe/ics-openvpn/issues/185\">Выпуск 185 < a> для получения дополнительной информации"

Существует несколько клиентов OpenVPN для Android. Наиболее распространенными являются OpenVPN для Android (этот клиент), OpenVPN Connect и OpenVPN Settings. < р > Клиентов можно разделить на две группы: OpenVPN для Android и OpenVPN Connect используют официальный API VPNService (Android 4.0+) и не требуют рута и настроек OpenVPN, которые используют рут. < р > OpenVPN для Android — это клиент с открытым исходным кодом, разработанный Арне Швабе. Он ориентирован на более продвинутых пользователей и предлагает множество настроек и возможность импортировать профили из файлов, а также настраивать/изменять профили внутри приложения. Клиент основан на общедоступной версии OpenVPN. Он основан на исходном коде OpenVPN 2.x. Этот клиент можно рассматривать как полуофициальный клиент сообщества. < р > OpenVPN Connect — это клиент с открытым исходным кодом, разработанный OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. Клиент предназначен для общего использования и больше ориентирован на среднего пользователя и позволяет импортировать профили OpenVPN. Этот клиент основан на повторной реализации OpenVPN C++ протокола OpenVPN (это было необходимо, чтобы позволить OpenVPN Technologies, Inc опубликовать приложение iOS OpenVPN). Этот клиент является официальным клиентом технологий OpenVPN < р > Настройки OpenVPN — это самый старый из клиентов, а также пользовательский интерфейс для OpenVPN с открытым исходным кодом. В отличие от OpenVPN для Android, он требует root и не использует VPNService API. Это не зависит от Android 4.0+
Различия между клиентами OpenVPN для Android

Android поддерживает только маршруты CIDR к VPN. Поскольку маршруты, отличные от CIDR, почти никогда не используются, OpenVPN для Android будет использовать /32 для маршрутов, не являющихся CIDR, и выдаст предупреждение.
Тетеринг работает, пока VPN активна. Привязное соединение НЕ будет использовать VPN.
Ранняя версия KitKat устанавливала неправильное значение MSS для TCP-соединений (#61948). Попробуйте включить параметр mssfix, чтобы обойти эту ошибку.

Android продолжит использовать настройки прокси-сервера, указанные для мобильного/Wi-Fi-подключения, если DNS-серверы не установлены. OpenVPN для Android предупредит вас об этом в журнале.
Когда VPN устанавливает DNS-сервер, Android не будет использовать прокси. Не существует API для установки прокси-сервера для VPN-подключения.
Приложения VPN могут перестать работать при удалении и повторной установке. Подробнее см. #80074
Настроенный IP-адрес клиента и IP-адреса в его сетевой маске не направляются в VPN. OpenVPN обходит эту ошибку, явно добавляя маршрут, который соответствует IP-адресу клиента и его сетевой маске

Открытие устройства tun, когда другое устройство tun активно, что используется для поддержки сохранения tun. , аварийно завершает работу VPNServices на устройстве. Требуется перезагрузка, чтобы VPN снова заработал. OpenVPN для Android пытается избежать повторного открытия устройства TUN и, если это действительно необходимо, сначала закрывает текущий TUN, прежде чем открывать новое устройство TUN, чтобы избежать сбоя. Это может привести к короткому окну, когда пакеты отправляются через соединение без VPN. Даже с этим обходным решением VPNServices иногда дает сбой и требует перезагрузки устройства.
VPN вообще не работает для вторичных пользователей.

«Несколько пользователей сообщают, что мобильное соединение/мобильное соединение для передачи данных часто обрывается при использовании приложения VPN. Такое поведение, по-видимому, влияет только на некоторую комбинацию мобильного провайдера/устройства, и до сих пор не удалось определить причину или обходной путь для этой ошибки».
Через VPN можно достичь только пункта назначения, доступного без VPN. VPN IPv6 вообще не работают.
Указать настраиваемые параметры подключения. Используйте с осторожностью
Ошибка соединения с SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:sslv3, ошибка рукопожатия

Новые версии OpenVPN для Android (0.6.29/март 2015 г.) используют более безопасное значение по умолчанию для разрешенных наборы шифров (tls-шифр "ПО УМОЛЧАНИЮ:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"). К сожалению, исключение менее безопасных наборов шифров и наборов экспортных шифров, особенно отсутствие наборов шифров, которые не поддерживают совершенную прямую секретность (Диффи-Хеллмана), вызывает некоторые проблемы. Обычно это вызвано благонамеренной, но плохо выполненной попыткой усилить безопасность TLS путем установки tls-шифра на сервере или некоторых встроенных ОС с урезанным SSL (например, MikroTik).\nЧтобы решить эту проблему, установите tls-шифр настройки на сервере в разумные значения по умолчанию, такие как tls-шифр \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\". Чтобы обойти проблему на клиенте, добавьте пользовательскую опцию tls-cipher DEFAULT на клиенте Android.

Несмотря на то, что телефоны Samsung являются одними из самых продаваемых телефонов Android, прошивка Samsung также являются одними из самых глючных прошивок Android. Ошибки не ограничиваются работой VPN на этих устройствах, но многие из них можно обойти. Ниже описаны некоторые из этих ошибок.

VPN используется в местах, где требуется VPN по умолчанию. В настоящее время они загружаются для Always-On и плитки быстрых настроек.
Введите максимальное время между попытками подключения. OpenVPN будет медленно увеличивать время ожидания после неудачной попытки подключения до этого значения. По умолчанию 300 с.

Если вы не получили диалоговое окно подтверждения VPN, у вас включена функция \"Всегда включена VPN\" для другого приложения. В этом случае только этому приложению разрешено подключаться к VPN. Проверьте в разделе Настройки-> Сети больше .. -> VPNS

< p>Начиная с OpenSSL версии 1.1, OpenSSL отклоняет слабые подписи в таких сертификатах, как MD5. < /p> < р> < b>Подписи MD5 полностью небезопасны и не должны больше использоваться. < /b> Коллизии MD5 можно создавать в < a href="https://natmchugh.blogspot.de/2015/02/create-your-own-md5-collisions.html">несколько часов по минимальной цене. < /а>. Вы должны обновить сертификаты VPN как можно скорее. < /p> < p>К сожалению, старые дистрибутивы easy-rsa включали параметр конфигурации «default_md md5». Если вы используете старую версию easy-rsa, обновите до < a href="https://github.com/OpenVPN/easy-rsa/releases">последняя версия < /a>) или измените md5 на sha256 и перегенерируйте свои сертификаты. < /p> < p>Если вы действительно хотите использовать старые и неработающие сертификаты, используйте параметр пользовательской конфигурации tls-cipher "DEFAULT:@SECLEVEL=0" в расширенной конфигурации или в качестве дополнительной строки в вашей импортированной конфигурации < /p>
Слабые (MD5) хэши в подписи сертификата (SSL_CTX_use_certificate md слишком слабый)

OpenVPN для Android поддерживает два удаленных API, сложный API с использованием AIDL ( remoteEXample в репозитории git) и простой с использованием Intents. < p> Примеры использования оболочки adb и намерения. Замените имя профиля на имя вашего профиля < р> < p> adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.DisconnectVPN < p> adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN -e de.blinkt.openvpn.api.profileName Blinkt de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.ConnectVPN
Невозможно одновременно использовать дополнительную инструкцию http-proxy-option и интеграцию с Orbot

Часто желательно заблокировать соединения без VPN. Другие приложения часто используют термины маркировки, такие как «Killswitch» или «Бесшовный туннель» для этой функции. OpenVPN и это приложение предлагают функцию persist-tun для реализации этой функции. < p>Проблема со всеми этими методами, предлагаемыми приложениями, заключается в том, что они могут только приложить максимум усилий и не являются полным решением. При загрузке, сбое приложения и других крайних случаях приложение не может гарантировать, что этот блок не VPN-подключения работает. Тем самым давая пользователю ложное чувство безопасности. < р> < б>только < /b> надежный способ обеспечить блокировку не VPN-подключений — использовать Android 8.0 или более позднюю версию и использовать параметр «блокировать подключения без VPN», который можно найти в разделе «Настройки»> «Сеть и сеть». Интернет > Дополнительно/VPN > OpenVPN для Android > Включить Always ON VPN, Включить блокировку соединений без VPN
Этот параметр указывает Android не разрешать протоколы (IPv4/IPv6), если VPN не установить любые адреса IPv4 или IPv6.
Блокировать IPv6 (или IPv4), если он не используется VPN
VPN по умолчанию не задан. Перед включением этой опции установите VPN по умолчанию.

Tap Mode is not possible with the non root VPN API. Therefore this application cannot provide tap support
Again? Are you kidding? No, tap mode is really not supported and sending more mail asking if it will be supported will not help.

A third time? Actually, one could write a tap emulator based on tun that would add layer2 information on send and strip layer2 information on receive. But this tap emulator would also have to implement ARP and possibly a DHCP client. I am not aware of anybody doing any work in this direction. Contact me if you want to start coding on this.

"As OpenVPN is security sensitive a few notes about security are sensible. All data on the sdcard is inherently insecure. Every app can read it (for example this program requires no special sd card rights). The data of this application can only be read by the application itself. By using the import option for cacert/cert/key in the file dialog the data is stored in the VPN profile. The VPN profiles are only accessible by this application. (Do not forget to delete the copies on the sd card afterwards). Even though accessible only by this application the data is still unencrypted. By rooting the telephone or other exploits it may be possible to retrieve the data. Saved passwords are stored in plain text as well. For pkcs12 files it is highly recommended that you import them into the android keystore."

Got an exception trying to show the Android 4.0+ certificate selection dialog. This should never happen as this a standard feature of Android 4.0+. Maybe your Android ROM support for certificate storage is broken

Official HTC images are known to have a strange routing problem causing traffic not to flow through the tunnel (See also Issue 18 in the bug tracker.)

Older official SONY images from Xperia Arc S and Xperia Ray have been reported to be missing the VPNService completely from the image. (See also Issue 29 in the bug tracker.)

On custom build images the tun module might be missing or the rights of /dev/tun might be wrong. Some CM9 images need the "Fix ownership" option under "Device specific hacks" enabled.

Most importantly: If your device has a broken Android image, report it to your vendor. The more people who report an issue to the vendor, the more likely they are to fix it.
Tries to set the owner of /dev/tun to system. Some CM9 images need this to make the VPNService API work. Requires root.

If Android is under system memory (RAM) pressure, apps and service which are not needed at the moment are removed from active memory. This terminates an ongoing VPN connection. To ensure that the connection/OpenVPN survives the service runs with higher priority. To run with higher priority the application must display a notification. The key notification icon is imposed by the system as described in the previous FAQ entry. It does not count as app notification for purpose of running with higher priority.

The Routing and interface configuration is not done via traditional ifconfig/route commands but by using the VPNService API. This results in a different routing configuration than on other OSes. 
The configuration of the VPN tunnel consists of the IP address and the networks that should be routed over this interface. Especially, no peer partner address or gateway address is needed or required. Special routes to reach the VPN Server (for example added when using redirect-gateway) are not needed either. The application will consequently ignore these settings when importing a configuration. The app ensures with the VPNService API that the connection to the server is not routed through the VPN tunnel.
The VPNService API does not allow specifying networks that should not be routed via the VPN. As a workaround the app tries to detect networks that should not be routed over tunnel (e.g. route x.x.x.x y.y.y.y net_gateway) and calculates a set of routes that excludes this routes to emulate the behaviour of other platforms. The log windows shows the configuration of the VPNService upon establishing a connection.
Behind the scenes: Android 4.4+ does use policy routing. Using route/ifconfig will not show the installed routes. Instead use ip rule, iptables -t mangle -L
Do not fallback to no VPN connection when OpenVPN is reconnecting.

In my personal tests the main reason for high battery consumption of OpenVPN are the keepalive packets. Most OpenVPN servers have a configuration directive like \'keepalive 10 60\' which causes the client and server to exchange keepalive packets every ten seconds.

While these packets are small and do not use much traffic, they keep the mobile radio network busy and increase the energy consumption. (See also The Radio State Machine | Android Developers)

This keepalive setting cannot be changed on the client. Only the system administrator of the OpenVPN can change the setting.

Unfortunately using a keepalive larger than 60 seconds with UDP can cause some NAT gateways to drop the connection due to an inactivity timeout. Using TCP with a long keep alive timeout works, but tunneling TCP over TCP performs extremely poorly on connections with high packet loss. (See Why TCP Over TCP Is A Bad Idea)

Multiple OpenVPN clients for Android exist. The most common ones are OpenVPN for Android (this client), OpenVPN Connect and OpenVPN Settings.

The clients can be grouped into two groups: OpenVPN for Android and OpenVPN Connect use the official VPNService API (Android 4.0+) and require no root and OpenVPN Settings which uses root.

OpenVPN for Android is an open source client and developed by Arne Schwabe. It is targeted at more advanced users and offers many settings and the ability to import profiles from files and to configure/change profiles inside the app. The client is based on the community version of OpenVPN. It is based on the OpenVPN 2.x source code. This client can be seen as the semi officially client of the community.

OpenVPN Connect is non open source client that is developed by OpenVPN Technologies, Inc. The client is indented to be general use client and more targeted at the average user and allows the import of OpenVPN profiles. This client is based on the OpenVPN C++ reimplementation of the OpenVPN protocol (This was required to allow OpenVPN Technologies, Inc to publish an iOS OpenVPN app). This client is the official client of the OpenVPN technologies

OpenVPN Settings is the oldest of the clients and also a UI for the open source OpenVPN. In contrast to OpenVPN for Android it requires root and does not use the VPNService API. It does not depend on Android 4.0+
Differences between the OpenVPN Android clients
Android supports only CIDR routes to the VPN. Since non-CIDR routes are almost never used, OpenVPN for Android will use a /32 for routes that are not CIDR and issue a warning.
Tethering works while the VPN is active. The tethered connection will NOT use the VPN.
Early KitKat version set the wrong MSS value on TCP connections (#61948). Try to enable the mssfix option to workaround this bug.

Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for the mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set. OpenVPN for Android will warn you about this in the log.
When a VPN sets a DNS server Android will not use a proxy. There is no API to set a proxy for a VPN connection.
VPN apps may stop working when uninstalled and reinstalled again. For details see #80074
The configured client IP and the IPs in its network mask are not routed to the VPN. OpenVPN works around this bug by explicitly adding a route that corrosponds to the client IP and its netmask

Opening a tun device while another tun device is active, which is used for persist-tun support, crashes the VPNServices on the device. A reboot is required to make VPN work again. OpenVPN for Android tries to avoid reopening the tun device and if really needed first closes the current TUN before opening the new TUN device to avoid to crash. This may lead to a short window where packets are sent over the non-VPN connection. Even with this workaround the VPNServices sometimes crashes and requires a reboot of the device.
VPN does not work at all for secondary users.

Newer OpenVPN for Android versions (0.6.29/March 2015) use a more secure default for the allowed cipher suites (tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\"). Unfortunately, omitting the less secure cipher suites and export cipher suites, especially the omission of cipher suites that do not support Perfect Forward Secrecy (Diffie-Hellman) causes some problems. This usually caused by an well-intentioned but poorly executed attempt to strengthen TLS security by setting tls-cipher on the server or some embedded OSes with stripped down SSL (e.g. MikroTik).\nTo solve this problem the problem, set the tls-cipher settings on the server to reasonable default like tls-cipher \"DEFAULT:!EXP:!PSK:!SRP:!kRSA\". To work around the problem on the client add the custom option tls-cipher DEFAULT on the Android client.

Even though Samsung phones are among the most selling Android phones, Samsung's firmware are also among the most buggy Android firmwares. The bugs are not limited to the VPN operation on these devices but many of them can be workarounded. In the following some of these bugs are described.

DNS does not work unless the DNS server in the VPN range.

On many Samsung 5.x devices the allowed/disallowed apps feature does not work.
On Samsung 6.x VPN is reported not to work unless the VPN app is exempted from Powersave features.

If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have \"Always on VPN\" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS

Starting with OpenSSL version 1.1, OpenSSL rejects weak signatures in certificates like MD5.

MD5 signatures are completely insecure and should not be used anymore. MD5 collisions can be created in few hours at a minimal cost.. You should update the VPN certificates as soon as possible.

Unfortunately, older easy-rsa distributions included the config option "default_md md5". If you are using an old easy-rsa version, update to the latest version) or change md5 to sha256 and regenerate your certificates.

If you really want to use old and broken certificates use the custom configuration option tls-cipher "DEFAULT:@SECLEVEL=0" under advanced configuration or as additional line in your imported configuration

OpenVPN for Android supports two remote APIs, a sophisticated API using AIDL (remoteEXample in the git repository) and a simple one using Intents.

Examples using adb shell and the intents. Replace profilname with your profile name

adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.DisconnectVPN

adb shell am start-activity -a android.intent.action.MAIN -e de.blinkt.openvpn.api.profileName Blinkt de.blinkt.openvpn/.api.ConnectVPN

It is often desired to block connections without VPN. Other apps often use markting terms like \"Killswitch\" or \"Seamless tunnel\" for this feature. OpenVPN and this app offer persist-tun, a feature to implement this functionality.

The problem with all these methods offered by apps is that they can only provide best effort and are no complete solutions. On boot, app crashing and other corner cases the app cannot ensure that this block of non VPN connection works. Thus giving the user a false sense of security.

The only reliable way to ensure non VPN connections are blocked is to use Android 8.0 or later and use the \"block connections without VPN\" setting that can be found under Settings > Network & Internet > Advanced/VPN > OpenVPN for Android > Enable Always ON VPN, Enable Block Connections without VPN
This option instructs Android to not allow protocols (IPv4/IPv6) if the VPN does not set any IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.
Block IPv6 (or IPv4) if not used by the VPN
